intro: Lippia rubiginosa var. dives, commonly known as the red lippia or scarlet lippia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring aromatic, hairy leaves with a distinctive reddish hue. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, often arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. The plant is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
